Im August 2023 beschuldigten die Philippinen die chinesische Küstenwache, ihre Boote mit Wasserwerfern angegriffen zu haben. Kurz darauf kursierten Videoausschnitte von Kampfflugzeugen in sozialen Netzwerken mit der falschen Behauptung, dass Deutschland die Philippinen mit militärischen Waffen gegen China versorgen würde. Diese Videoausschnitte sind jedoch aus dem Kontext gerissen. Von sowohl deutscher als auch philippinischer Seite wird offiziell bestätigt, dass es zu keinem derartigen Waffendeal gekommen sei. Zudem erklärten Sicherheitsexperten gegenüber AFP, dass ein solches Szenario unwahrscheinlich sei.
„Philippinisches Militär bewaffnet von deutschen Truppen gegen China“, lautet der Titel (auf Tagolog) eines neunminütigen Videos, das am 16. August 2023 auf Youtube veröffentlicht wurde.
In der Beschreibung heißt es: „Starke Waffen der Bundeswehr werden an die philippinischen Streitkräfte geschickt! Seht euch dieses Video an, um alle Einzelheiten zu dieser Nachricht zu erfahren!“
Der erste Teil des Videos besteht aus einer Reihe von Ausschnitten, die Kampfjets und marschierende Truppen zeigen, während ein Sprecher die falsche Behauptung wiederholt.
Im zweiten Teil geht es um die Bitte Washingtons an Manila, afghanische Staatsbürgerinnen und Staatsbürger, die auf eine Neuansiedlung in den Vereinigten Staaten warten, vorübergehend aufzunehmen.
Das Video wurde über 40.000 Mal angesehen.
Das Video wurde von einem Facebook-Konto mit über 31.000 Abonnentinnen und Abonnenten veröffentlicht, aber auch von anderen Konten: hier und hier.
Die Philippinen verurteilten die chinesische Küstenwache dafür, am 5. August 2023 im umstrittenen Südchinesischen Meer ihre Schiffe mit Wasserwerfern angegriffen zu haben und bezeichneten das Vorgehen als illegal und gefährlich.
China erklärte daraufhin, es habe „notwendige Regulierungen“ von philippinischen Booten durchgeführt, die „illegal“ in chinesische Gewässer eingedrungen seien.
Peking beansprucht fast das gesamte Südchinesische Meer für sich, durch das jährlich Handelsströme in Höhe von Billionen US-Dollar fließen, und ignoriert das Urteil eines internationalen Gerichts aus dem Jahr 2016, wonach diese Anspruchshaltung keine rechtliche Grundlage hat.
In einer englischsprachigen Erklärung, die am 6. August 2023 auf Facebook geteilt wurde, erklärte die deutsche Botschaft in Manila, sie sei „besorgt“ über den Vorfall (Link hier archiviert).
Europa rüste das philippinische Militär jedoch nicht auf, sagte Alexander Schmidt, Erster Sekretär für Politische Angelegenheiten der Deutschen Botschaft in Manila, gegenüber AFP am 21. August 2023.
„Die Behauptung, dass Deutschland den Philippinen im Streit um die westphilippinische See Flugabwehrmunition und Anti-Schiffs-Raketen überlassen habe oder überlasse, ist falsch“, sagte Schmidt.
Manila bezeichnet die unmittelbar westlich gelegenen Gewässer als Westphilippinisches Meer.
Schmidt fügte hinzu, dass sich Deutschland weiterhin für die Aufrechterhaltung der regelbasierten maritimen Ordnung „mit friedlichen Mitteln“ einsetze.
Auf die Frage, ob die Philippinen kürzlich Waffen aus Deutschland erhalten hätten, sagte Oberstleutnant Enrico Gil Ileto, Leiter der Abteilung für öffentliche Angelegenheiten der philippinischen Streitkräfte, am 18. August 2023 gegenüber AFP: „Nein, das haben wir nicht.“
Videoausschnitte aus einem anderen Kontext
Eine umgekehrte Bildsuche mit Standbildern aus dem Video ergab, dass Ausschnitte verwendet wurden, die nichts mit dem Streit um das Südchinesische Meer zu tun haben.
Die Szene ab Sekunde 00:15, in der ein Kampfjet zu sehen ist, der an einem Soldaten vorbeifliegt, zeigt in Wirklichkeit eine gemeinsame Militärübung von estnischen und deutschen Streitkräften im Baltikum, Baltic Tiger 2022.
Das Video wurde von der Bundeswehr am 18. Oktober 2022 auf X, ehemals Twitter, veröffentlicht (Link hier archiviert).
Der Ausschnitt mit fackeltragenden Soldaten bei Sekunde 00:45 stammt aus einem Video, das die Bundeswehr am 13. Oktober 2021 auf X hochgeladen hatte (Link hier archiviert).
„Zur #Würdigung aller Beteiligten des #Afghanistan Einsatzes wird es heute Abend einen großen Zapfenstreich geben“, heißt es in dem X-Beitrag der Bundeswehr.
Der Große Zapfenstreich ist die wichtigste Form eines Festaktes der deutschen Streitkräfte. AFP hat auch über die Zeremonie berichtet.
Eine weitere Szene, die bei Minute 1:01 einen Kampfjet beim Verlassen eines Hangars zeigt, wurde ursprünglich auf einer Nato-Website hochgeladen und zeigt einen italienischen F-35A-Kampfjet (Link hier archiviert).
In dem Video wurden auch Aufnahmen einer Militärparade anlässlich der Amtseinführung des philippinischen Präsidenten Ferdinand Marcos im Juni 2022 verwendet (Link hier archiviert).
Unwahrscheinliches Szenario
AFP hat keine glaubwürdigen Berichte oder Offenlegungen der Regierung gefunden, die die Behauptung in den verbreiteten Beiträgen stützen (Link hier archiviert).
Experten gehen davon aus, dass über ein wie in den Beiträgen beschriebenes Szenario auf jeden Fall berichtet worden wäre.
Chester Cabalza ist Chef und Gründer von IDSC, einer in Manila ansässigen gemeinnützigen internationalen Organisation für Entwicklungs- und Sicherheitskooperation. Er sagte am 28. August 2023 gegenüber AFP, dass internationale Waffengeschäfte strengen Transparenzregeln in der Planungs-, Verhandlungs-, Beschaffungs- und Lieferphase folgten.
Ein Szenario, in dem Deutschland die Philippinen heimlich bewaffnet, sei ebenfalls unwahrscheinlich, schrieb Edcel John Ibarra, Assistenzprofessor für Politikwissenschaft an der Universität der Philippinen in einer Mail am 29. August 2023 an AFP.
„Selbst wenn die Offenlegung nicht gesetzlich vorgeschrieben ist, wird sie von den Lieferländern dennoch häufig vorgenommen, weil ein Waffengeschäft an sich oft schon ein nützliches Signal der Abschreckung ist“, so Ibarra.
„Verdeckte Waffenlieferungen an die Philippinen würden den Effekt der Abschreckung zunichte machen und die Gelegenheit verstreichen lassen, Verteidigungsdiplomatie zu betreiben.“
Fazit: Deutschland liefert keine Waffen an die Philippinen zur Unterstützung gegen China. Das wurde sowohl von philippinischer als auch von deutscher Seite offiziell gegenüber AFP bestätigt. Sicherheitsexperten sagten außerdem, dass das Szenario eines verdeckten Waffendeals sehr unwahrscheinlich sei. Die verbreiteten Videoausschnitte zeigen unter anderem eine gemeinsame Militärübung deutscher und estnischer Soldatinnen und Soldaten aus dem Jahr 2022.
Translation:
In August 2023, the Philippines accused the Chinese coast guard of attacking its boats with water cannons. Shortly thereafter, video clips from fighter jets began circulating on social media with the false claim that Germany was supplying the Philippines with military weapons against China. However, these video excerpts are taken out of context. Both the German and Filipino sides have officially confirmed that no such arms deal took place. Security experts also told AFP that such a scenario was unlikely.
“Philippine military armed by German troops against China,” is the title (in Tagolog) of a nine-minute video posted on YouTube on August 16, 2023.
The description says: “Powerful weapons from the Bundeswehr are being sent to the Philippine Armed Forces! Watch this video for full details on this news!”
The first part of the video consists of a series of clips showing fighter jets and troops marching while a narrator repeats the false claim.
The second part is about Washington's request to Manila to temporarily accept Afghan citizens awaiting resettlement in the United States.
The video has been viewed over 40,000 times.
The video was published by a Facebook account with over 31,000 subscribers, but also by other accounts: here and here.
The Philippines condemned the Chinese coast guard for attacking its ships with water cannons in the disputed South China Sea on August 5, 2023, calling the action illegal and dangerous.
China then said it had carried out "necessary regulations" on Filipino boats that had "illegally" entered Chinese waters.
Beijing claims almost the entire South China Sea, through which trillions of dollars of trade flows annually, ignoring a 2016 ruling by an international court that the claim has no legal basis.
In an English-language statement shared on Facebook on August 6, 2023, the German Embassy in Manila said it was “concerned” about the incident (link archived here).
However, Europe is not arming the Philippine military, Alexander Schmidt, First Secretary for Political Affairs at the German Embassy in Manila, told AFP on August 21, 2023.
“The claim that Germany has given or is giving the Philippines anti-aircraft ammunition and anti-ship missiles in the dispute over the West Philippine Sea is false,” said Schmidt.
Manila refers to the waters immediately to the west as the West Philippine Sea.
Schmidt added that Germany remains committed to maintaining the rules-based maritime order “through peaceful means.”
Asked if the Philippines had recently received weapons from Germany, Lt. Col. Enrico Gil Ileto, head of the public affairs department of the Armed Forces of the Philippines, told AFP on August 18, 2023: "No, we have not."
Video excerpts from a different context
A reverse image search of stills from the video revealed that excerpts unrelated to the South China Sea dispute were used.
The scene from second 00:15, in which a fighter jet can be seen flying past a soldier, actually shows a joint military exercise between Estonian and German armed forces in the Baltics, Baltic Tiger 2022.
The video was published by the Bundeswehr on October 18, 2022 on X, formerly Twitter (link archived here).
The excerpt with soldiers carrying torches at 00:45 seconds comes from a video that the Bundeswehr uploaded to X on October 13, 2021 (link archived here).
“To #appreciate everyone involved in the #Afghanistan operation, there will be a big tattoo this evening,” says the Bundeswehr’s X post.
The Great Tattoo is the most important form of ceremony for the German armed forces. AFP also reported on the ceremony.
Another scene showing a fighter jet leaving a hangar at minute 1:01 was originally uploaded to a NATO website and shows an Italian F-35A fighter jet (link archived here).
The video also used footage of a military parade marking the inauguration of Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos in June 2022 (link archived here).
Unlikely scenario
AFP found no credible reports or government disclosures to support the claim in the circulated posts (link archived here).
Experts assume that a scenario like the one described in the articles would definitely have been reported.
Chester Cabalza is the head and founder of IDSC, a Manila-based non-profit international development and security cooperation organization. He told AFP on August 28, 2023 that international arms deals followed strict transparency rules in the planning, negotiation, procurement and delivery phases.
A scenario in which Germany secretly arms the Philippines is also unlikely, wrote Edcel John Ibarra, assistant professor of political science at the University of the Philippines, in an email to AFP on August 29, 2023.
“Even if disclosure is not required by law, it is still often done by supplying countries because an arms deal in itself is often a useful signal of deterrence,” said Ibarra.
“Covert arms transfers to the Philippines would negate the effect of deterrence and miss the opportunity to conduct defense diplomacy.”
Conclusion: Germany does not supply weapons to the Philippines to support it against China. This was officially confirmed to AFP by both the Filipino and German sides. Security experts also said that the scenario of a covert arms deal was very unlikely. The video excerpts distributed show, among other things, a joint military exercise between German and Estonian soldiers from 2022.

Factcheck: nee, foto bewijst niet dat Israël anno 2021 witte fosfor gebruikt als chemisch wapen
Deze factcheck is uitgevoerd op basis van de beschikbare informatie op de datum van publicatie. Lees hier meer over hoe we werken.
Waarschuwing: deze factcheck bevat schokkende beelden. Op Instagram circuleert een foto die zou bewijzen dat Israël in het huidige conflict met Palestina witte fosfor gebruikt, een chemisch wapen. Het blijkt te gaan om de foto van een kind dat verminkt raakte door een aanval met witte fosfor in 2009, in de Afghaanse hoofdstad Kaboel.
Op 15 mei plaatst de Instagrampagina rappelons.nous, die 74.300 volgers heeft, een screenshot online. Instagram bestempelt het beeld als ‘gevoelige inhoud’, omdat het ‘mogelijk gewelddadige of expliciete inhoud’ bevat.
We zien de foto van een zwaar verminkt kind. Boven de foto staat in het Frans: ‘Israël gebruikt witte fosfor (een chemisch element dat brandt bij huidcontact) tegen Palestijnse burgers, hoe ver zullen ze gaan in de gruwel? Ze vermoorden iedereen en laten hun doelwit afzien, het zijn duivelse schepsels!’ De afbeelding krijgt 3676 vind-ik-leuks en 37.000 mensen zien ze op hun tijdlijn passeren.
Bron?
We zoeken de oorspronkelijke bron van het bericht. We googelen de Franse tekst tussen aanhalingstekens om de exacte woorden in dezelfde volgorde terug te vinden.
We krijgen slechts twee zoekresultaten, die ons beide naar Twitter leiden. De afbeelding toont twee Twitterberichten van 12 mei 2021: een dat de tekst bevat, het andere met de foto.
Beide tweets zijn van @maghreboff, dat zich ‘de enige officiële account van de Maghreb’ noemt, met vlagjes van Tunesië, Marokko en Algerije erbij.
De account werd aangemaakt in januari 2020 en heeft slechts 100 volgers. Dat laatste doet vermoeden dat het hier niet om een officiële account van de Maghreb-landen gaat.
Bron van de foto?
Toont de foto een Palestijns slachtoffer van een aanval van Israël met witte fosfor? We laden de afbeelding op in de zoekmachine TinEye.
De foto kwam al online in januari 2017 met als bestandsnaam ‘burns-afghanistan-white’ (rood kader). De foto dateert dus van vóór de recente aanval van Israël op de Palestijnse gebieden en lijkt te verwijzen naar Afghanistan en niet naar Israël. We laden dezelfde foto ook op bij de zoekmachine Bing, om nog meer resultaten terug te vinden.
Zo komen we uit bij een artikel van het Amerikaanse ABC News van 9 november 2020 met als titel ‘Menselijke tol van brandwapens gedocumenteerd in nieuw rapport’. In de inleiding lezen we dat het artikel gaat over een nieuw rapport over het gebruik van brandwapens in conflictgebieden Afghanistan, de Gazastrook en Syrië. Auteurs zijn mensenrechtenorganisatie Human Rights Watch (HRW) en onderzoekers aan de universiteit van Harvard.
Het artikel dateert dus van vóór de recente aanval van Israël op de Palestijnse gebieden. Het artikel stelt dat het rapport van HRW beschrijft hoe het achtjarige Afghaanse meisje Razia, wiens achternaam niet bekend is, over 45 procent van haar lichaam brandwonden opliep bij een aanval met witte fosfor nabij de Afghaanse hoofdstad Kaboel in 2009.
Witte fosfor is een giftige chemische stof die onder andere als pesticide en in vuurwerk wordt gebruikt. Militair dient het in verschillende soorten munitie als brand- en rookmiddel. Als het in aanraking komt met lucht, ontbrandt het spontaan.
Een ander artikel van 24 juni 2009, dat we vinden op de Slowaakse nieuwssite Noviny.sk, bevestigt het slachtofferschap van Razia. Het artikel ‘Witte fosfor vernietigt achtjarige Afghaans meisje’ bevat dezelfde foto en toont ook andere beelden van het zwaargewonde meisje in een militair hospitaal.We zoeken via de Russische zoekmachine Yandex nogmaals met dezelfde foto om nog meer bronnen te vinden die de foto gebruiken.
Zo komen we uit bij een artikel van de Australische nieuwssite news.com.au van 31 oktober 2016. Het onderschrift bij de foto verwijst opnieuw naar de Afghaanse Razia die in 2009 acht jaar was, en ook dit artikel gaat breder over het gebruik van witte fosfor in verschillende conflicten door de jaren heen in Afghanistan, Irak, Syrië en Israël.
Het artikel verwijst naar het HRW-rapport Vuurregen van 25 maart 2009. Dat rapport documenteert het gebruik van munitie met witte fosfor door het Israëlische leger in de Gazastrook van 27 december 2008 tot 19 januari 2009. In die periode gebruikte Israël herhaaldelijk luchtmunitie met witte fosfor boven dichtbevolkte gebied met burgerslachtoffers en -doden als gevolg. Volgens HRW schond Israël hiermee het internationale oorlogsrecht.
Gebruikt Israël ook witte fosfor in de huidige escalatie van geweld, zoals wordt beweerd in verschillende posts op sociale media?
https://twitter.com/JumanaKhader/status/1392276647618007046جمانة جميل 𓂆https://twitter.com/JumanaKhader
Israel is using White phosphorus munitions on the civilians in gaza strip while you’re reading this tweet which are internationally prohibited weapons. White phosphorus causes burns in the human body to the point that it can reach the bone. #GazaUnderAttack
— جمانة جميل 𓂆 (@JumanaKhader) May 12, 2021
Je kan jouw keuzes op elk moment wijzigen door onderaan de site op "Cookie-instellingen" te klikken."
550rich3153600000Twitterhttps://twitter.com1.0
Daarvoor is tot op heden geen bewijs gevonden. Het Amerikaanse tijdschrift Newsweek liet recente beelden van Israëlische aanvallen die circuleren op Twitter bekijken door militaire experten en zij konden niet bevestigen dat het hier om aanvallen met witte fosfor ging. ‘Het Israëlische leger heeft dergelijke munitie niet ingezet’, liet een woordvoerder van het Israëlische leger recent aan Newsweek weten.
Nicholas Heras, analist bij de geopolitieke denktank Newlines Institute for Strategy and Policy, zei aan Newsweek: ‘Het Israëlisch leger probeert over het algemeen in het voorbije decennium weg te blijven van het gebruik van munitie met witte fosfor. […] Maar, witte fosfor maakt nog steeds een deel uit van hun arsenaal.’
Conclusie
De foto op Instagram vormt geen bewijs dat Israël recent witte fosfor gebruikte in aanvallen tegen Palestijnse burgers. Hiervoor is tot op heden geen bewijs gevonden. Wel gebruikte Israël in 2008-2009 witte fosfor bij aanvallen op de Gazastrook.
De foto toont de achtjarige Afghaanse Razia die het slachtoffer werd van witte fosfor in 2009. De tekst in combinatie met de foto is sterk misleidend en beoordelen we daarom als onwaar.

- Gearchiveerde Twitterpost (11 mei 2021)
- Gearchiveerde Twitterpost (11 mei 2021)
- Gearchiveerde Twitteraccount
- ABC News (9 november 2020)
- AP (24 juni 2009)
- CDC
- Noviny.sk (24 juni 2009)
- News.com.au (31 oktober 2016)
- Rain of Fire (25 maart 2009)
- GearchiveerdeTwitterpost (12 mei 2021)

Alle bronnen werden laatst geraadpleegd op 18 mei 2021.

Translation:
Fact check: no, photo does not prove that Israel uses white phosphorus as a chemical weapon in 2021
This fact check was carried out based on the information available at the date of publication. Read more about how we work here.
Warning: This fact check contains disturbing images. A photo is circulating on Instagram that purports to prove that Israel is using white phosphorus, a chemical weapon, in the current conflict with Palestine. It turns out to be the photo of a child who was mutilated by a white phosphorus attack in 2009 in the Afghan capital Kabul.
On May 15, the Instagram page rappelons.nous, which has 74,300 followers, posted a screenshot online. Instagram labels the image as 'sensitive content' because it contains 'potentially violent or explicit content'.
We see the photo of a badly mutilated child. Above the photo it says in French: 'Israel uses white phosphorus (a chemical element that burns on skin contact) against Palestinian civilians, how far will they go in the horror? They kill everyone and make their target suffer, they are devilish creatures!' The image gets 3,676 likes and 37,000 people see it on their timeline.
Source?
We're looking for the original source of the message. We google the French text in quotes to find the exact words in the same order.
We only get two search results, both of which take us to Twitter. The image shows two Twitter messages from May 12, 2021: one containing the text, the other with the photo.
Both tweets are from @maghreboff, which calls itself 'the only official account of the Maghreb', with flags of Tunisia, Morocco and Algeria.
The account was created in January 2020 and has only 100 followers. The latter suggests that this is not an official account of the Maghreb countries.
Source of the photo?
Does the photo show a Palestinian victim of an Israeli attack with white phosphorus? We load the image into the TinEye search engine.
The photo already appeared online in January 2017 with the file name 'burns-afghanistan-white' (red frame). The photo therefore dates from before Israel's recent attack on the Palestinian territories and appears to refer to Afghanistan and not Israel. We also upload the same photo to the Bing search engine to find even more results.
This brings us to an article from the American ABC News of November 9, 2020, entitled 'Human toll of incendiary weapons documented in new report'. In the introduction we read that the article is about a new report on the use of incendiary weapons in conflict areas Afghanistan, the Gaza Strip and Syria. The authors are human rights organization Human Rights Watch (HRW) and researchers at Harvard University.
The article therefore predates Israel's recent attack on the Palestinian territories. The article states that HRW's report describes how an eight-year-old Afghan girl Razia, whose surname is withheld, suffered burns on 45 percent of her body in a white phosphorus attack near the Afghan capital Kabul in 2009.
White phosphorus is a toxic chemical that is used as a pesticide and in fireworks, among other things. Militarily it serves as a fire and smoke agent in various types of ammunition. When it comes into contact with air, it ignites spontaneously.
Another article from June 24, 2009, which we find on the Slovak news site Noviny.sk, confirms Razia's victimhood. The article 'White phosphorus destroys eight-year-old Afghan girl' contains the same photo and also shows other images of the seriously injured girl in a military hospital. We search again with the same photo via the Russian search engine Yandex to find even more sources that use the photo.
This brings us to an article from the Australian news site news.com.au dated October 31, 2016. The caption for the photo again refers to the Afghan Razia who was eight years old in 2009, and this article is also more broadly about the use of white phosphorus in various conflicts over the years in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Israel.
The article refers to the HRW report Fire Rain of March 25, 2009. That report documents the use of white phosphorus ammunition by the Israeli army in the Gaza Strip from December 27, 2008 to January 19, 2009. During that period, Israel repeatedly used white phosphorus aerial ammunition above densely populated areas, resulting in civilian casualties and deaths. According to HRW, Israel thus violated international laws of war.
Is Israel also using white phosphorus in the current escalation of violence, as alleged in several social media posts?
https://twitter.com/JumanaKhader/status/1392276647618007046جمانة جميل 𓂆https://twitter.com/JumanaKhader
Israel is using White phosphorus munitions on the civilians in gaza strip while you're reading this tweet which are internationally prohibited weapons. White phosphorus causes burns in the human body to the point that it can reach the bone. #GazaUnderAttack
— جمانة جميل 𓂆 (@JumanaKhader) May 12, 2021
You can change your choices at any time by clicking "Cookie Settings" at the bottom of the site."
550rich3153600000Twitterhttps://twitter.com1.0
No evidence for this has been found to date. The American magazine Newsweek had military experts review recent images of Israeli attacks circulating on Twitter and they could not confirm that these were white phosphorus attacks. “The Israeli army has not used such ammunition,” an Israeli army spokesperson recently told Newsweek.
Nicholas Heras, an analyst at the geopolitical think tank Newlines Institute for Strategy and Policy, told Newsweek: “The Israeli military has generally tried to stay away from using white phosphorus ammunition over the past decade. […] But, white phosphorus is still part of their arsenal.”
Conclusion
The photo on Instagram does not prove that Israel recently used white phosphorus in attacks against Palestinian civilians. No evidence of this has been found to date. Israel did use white phosphorus in attacks on the Gaza Strip in 2008-2009.
The photo shows eight-year-old Afghan Razia who fell victim to white phosphorus in 2009. The text in combination with the photo is highly misleading and we therefore rate it as untrue.

Użytkownicy mediów społecznościowych na całym świecie udostępniali, od 13 kwietnia 2022 roku, nagranie z logo BBC przedstawiajace atak rakietowy na stację kolejową w Kramatorsku. BBC miało w nim twierdzić, że pocisk rakietowy w wyniku którego zginęło 55 cywilów, został wystrzelony przez Ukrainę. W rzeczywistości materiał ten został sfałszowany. Brytyjski nadawca poinformował, że nigdy takiego nagrania nie wyprodukował. Pokazujemy sposoby jak łatwo można rozpoznać oryginalne relacje BBC. Nadal nie wiadomo, kto jest odpowiedzialny za ostrzał stacji.
Do ataku na dworzec kolejowy w Kramatorsku, we wschodniej Ukrainie, doszło 8 kwietnia 2022 roku. Zginęło w nim 55 cywilów oczekujących na ewakuację z zagrożonych wojną terenów. W swojej publikacji na ten temat BBC napisało, że nie jest pewne która ze stron wystrzeliła pocisk, ale „istnieją dowody na to, że Rosja już wcześniej użyła tych pocisków w toczącym się obecnie konflikcie”. Ukraina również posiada ten rodzaj broni w swoim arsenale – napisał brytyjski nadawca.
Kilka dni po ataku, użytkownicy Facebooka zaczęli udostępniać sfałszowane nagranie sugerując równocześnie, że śledztwo BBC wykazało że za atak odpowiada Ukraina.
Nagranie na pierwszy rzut oka przypomina materiały BBC. Stwierdza się w nim, że numer seryjny widniejący na rakiecie użytej podczas ataku odpowiada numerowi, który znajduje się w arsenale sił zbrojnych Ukrainy, które już kilkakrotnie używały tego typu pocisków do ostrzalenia innych miast.
„Nie do wiary! BBC przyznało, że uderzenie rakietą w stację kolejową Kramatorsk, w której zginęło 55 cywilów, zostało popełnione przez Ukrainę. Tylko patrzeć, jak światowa narracja nagle zmieni się o 180 stopni i owce staną się wilkami!” – napisała 13 kwietnia 2022 roku jedna z użytkowniczek Facebooka. Podobne twierdzenia krążyły na Telegramie. O „szokujących twierdzeniach BBC” pisali holenderscy użytkownicy Twittera (publikacja miała ponad 600 udostępnień) a także polscy, słowaccy i francuscy.
Według redakcji The Guardian, sfałszowane nagranie pokazano w publicznej telewizji rosyjskiej.
Nagranie na pierwszy rzut oka przypomina materiały BBC. Kilka godzin po pojawieniu się w mediach społecznościowych nadawca przekazał, że film jest „fałszywy”. Widać to gołym okiem również po oznaczeniach graficznych, które są inne niż w oryginalnych materiałach BBC, co tłumaczymy poniżej.
Dementi BBC
Nagranie ukazało się 13 kwietnia. Kilka godzin później BBC opublikowało na Twitterze oświadczenie z informacją, że to materiał podrobiony. „Prosimy o nieudostępnianie nagrania i sprawdzanie materiałów na stronie internetowej BBC News” – czytamy w nim.
We are aware of a fake video with BBC News branding suggesting Ukraine was responsible for last week’s missile attack on Kramatorsk train station. The BBC is taking action to have the video removed. We urge people not to share it and to check stories on the BBC News website.
— BBC News Press Team (@BBCNewsPR) April 13, 2022
Korespondent BBC w Ukrainie Joe Inwood również przestrzegł na swoim koncie na Twitterze przed fejkowym wideo.
AFP nie udało się odnaleźć omawianego przez nas filmu w oficjalnych serwisach społecznościowych, ani na stronie internetowej BBC.
Wskazówki jak rozpoznać oryginalne materiały BBC
AFP porównało sfałszowane nagranie z materiałem BBC pochodzącym z konta nadawcy naTwitterze.
Na początku sfałszowanego nagrania widać wstrząsające obrazy – dziesiątki martwych ciał, ślady krwi. Nie pojawia się żadne ostrzeżenie z informacją dla ogłądającego, że film może przedstawiać przemoc lub drastyczne sceny. BBC ma zwyczaj dołączania takich ostrzeżeń do tego typu filmów. Na czerwonym tle pojawia się napis po angielsku: „Uwaga, szokujące obrazy”. Poniżej publikujemy zestawienie podrobionego nagrania z autentycznym wideo z ostrzeżeniem (zrzuty ekranu zrobiono w 3 sekundzie):
Dodatkowo, pionowa linia po lewej stronie od napisu w podrobionym nagraniu ma jeden, niezmienny wymiar, tymczasem w oryginalnym materiale BBC dostosowywana jest ona do długości tekstu.
W czerwonej ramce (po lewej) linia jest nieproporcjonalna duża względem napisu. W zielonej ramce (po prawej) pionowa linia dostosowana została do napisu.
Inna jest też pisownia nazwiska ukraińskiego prezydenta. W sfałszowanym nagraniu w nazwisku prezydenta pojawiają się dwie litery „y ”. BBC stosuje inną pisownię i pisze Zelensky z pojedynczym „y”. (Po polsku piszemy Zełenski.)
Istnieją również inne drobne różnice stylistyczne, takie jak brak trzech kropek w sfałszowanym nagraniu (po lewej), gdy zdanie jest podzielone na dwie części.
Kilka dni po ataku rakietowym na dworzec kolejowy w Kramatorsku 8 kwietnia 2022 r. nadal nie było jasne, kto ponosi za niego odpowiedzialność. PrezydentWołodymyr Zełenski o atak obwiniał Rosję, ale Moskwa twierdziła, że atak został przeprowadzony przez siły ukraińskie.
BBC w swojej relacji podała, że próbowała zidentyfikować miejsce wystrzelenia pocisku, korzystając z nagrań wideo i zdjęć z mediów społecznościowych, ale jak dotąd nie udało jej się tego zrobić.
W swoim dziennikarskim śledztwie w sprawie zbrodni w Buczy stwierdziła, że dowody, w tym zdjęcia satelitarne, zaprzeczają rosyjskim twierdzeniom, że wydarzenia te zostały „wyreżyserowane” po tym jak Rosjanie wycofali się z Buczy. AFP również wykazała że twierdzenia o inscenizacji są nieprawdziwe.
Sfałszowane wideo z ataku rakietowego w Kramatorsku wpisuje się w nurt spiskowej narracji według której zachodnie media przedstawiają fałszywy obraz konfliktu w Ukrainie.
Przykłady dezinformacji opisaliśmy na naszej stronie, m.in. w artykule o amerykańskiej telewizji CNN która miała przekazać nieprawdziwą relację ze Lwowa i w tekście o fałszywej okładce magazynu Time.
Translation:
Social media users around the world have been sharing, since April 13, 2022, a recording with the BBC logo showing a rocket attack on the railway station in Kramatorsk. The BBC allegedly claimed that the missile that killed 55 civilians was fired by Ukraine. In fact, this material was fake. The British broadcaster said it had never produced such a recording. We show you how to easily recognize original BBC reports. It is still unknown who is responsible for firing at the station.
The attack on the railway station in Kramatorsk, eastern Ukraine, took place on April 8, 2022. 55 civilians died while waiting for evacuation from war-threatened areas. In its publication on the subject, the BBC wrote that it was not certain which side fired the missile, but "there is evidence that Russia has previously used these missiles in the current conflict." Ukraine also has this type of weapon in its arsenal, wrote the British broadcaster.
A few days after the attack, Facebook users began sharing the fake footage, suggesting that a BBC investigation showed that Ukraine was responsible for the attack.
At first glance, the recording resembles BBC materials. It states that the serial number on the missile used in the attack corresponds to the number in the arsenal of the Ukrainian armed forces, which have already used this type of missiles several times to attack other cities.
“Unbelievable! The BBC admitted that the rocket attack on the Kramatorsk railway station, which killed 55 civilians, was committed by Ukraine. Just watch as the world narrative suddenly changes 180 degrees and sheep become wolves!” – wrote one of the Facebook users on April 13, 2022. Similar claims have been circulating on Telegram. Dutch Twitter users wrote about the "shocking claims of the BBC" (the publication had over 600 shares), as well as Polish, Slovak and French ones.
According to The Guardian, the fake recording was shown on Russian public television.
At first glance, the recording resembles BBC materials. Hours after it appeared on social media, the broadcaster said the video was "fake." This is also visible to the naked eye in the graphic markings, which are different than in the original BBC materials, which we explain below.
Dementi BBC
The recording was released on April 13. A few hours later, the BBC published a statement on Twitter saying that the material was fake. "We ask you not to share the recording and check the materials on the BBC News website," we read.
We are aware of a fake video with BBC News branding suggesting Ukraine was responsible for last week's missile attack on Kramatorsk train station. The BBC is taking action to have the video removed. We urge people not to share it and to check stories on the BBC News website.
— BBC News Press Team (@BBCNewsPR) April 13, 2022
BBC Ukraine correspondent Joe Inwood also warned against the fake video on his Twitter account.
AFP was unable to find the film in question on official social networking sites or on the BBC website.
Tips on how to recognize original BBC content
AFP compared the fake recording with BBC material from the broadcaster's Twitter account.
At the beginning of the fake recording, you can see shocking images - dozens of dead bodies, traces of blood. There is no warning informing the viewer that the film may contain violence or graphic scenes. The BBC has a habit of attaching such warnings to these types of videos. An inscription in English appears on a red background: "Attention, shocking images." Below we publish a comparison of the fake recording with the authentic warning video (screenshots were taken at 3 seconds):
Additionally, the vertical line to the left of the inscription in the fake recording has one, unchanging dimension, while in the original BBC material it is adjusted to the length of the text.
In the red frame (on the left), the line is disproportionately large compared to the inscription. In the green frame (on the right), the vertical line has been adjusted to the inscription.
The spelling of the Ukrainian president's name is also different. In the fake recording, two letters "y" appear in the president's name. The BBC uses a different spelling and spells Zelensky with a single "y". (In Polish we write Zełenski.)
There are also other minor stylistic differences, such as the absence of three dots in the fake recording (left) when the sentence is split into two parts.
A few days after the rocket attack on the Kramatorsk railway station on April 8, 2022, it was still unclear who was responsible for it. President Volodymyr Zelensky blamed Russia for the attack, but Moscow claimed the attack was carried out by Ukrainian forces.
The BBC said in its report that it had tried to identify the site of the missile launch using video and photos from social media, but had so far been unable to do so.
In her journalistic investigation into the Bucha crimes, she concluded that evidence, including satellite photos, contradicted Russian claims that the events were "staged" after the Russians withdrew from Bucha. AFP also found that the staging claims were false.
The fake video of the missile attack in Kramatorsk is part of the conspiracy narrative according to which Western media present a false image of the conflict in Ukraine.
We have described examples of disinformation on our website, including: in an article about the American television CNN which was supposed to transmit a false report from Lviv and in a text about a false cover of Time magazine.

FALS | În Anglia ar fi fost blocat soarele, pentru combaterea încălzirii globale
FALS | În Anglia ar fi fost blocat soarele, pentru combaterea încălzirii globale
Publicat miercuri 16 august 2023 la 09:32
Soarele este blocat în Marea Britanie, susține o postare virală pe rețelele de socializare, sugerând că acoperirea cu nori este, de fapt, rezultatul unei geoinginerii.
Și în România, un utilizator Facebook a postat un text cu același mesaj:
„În UK deja soarele este blocat. Cerul este acoperit în multe părți non stop de o pătură cenușie de nori”.
*Captură de ecran 06.08.2023
Mesajul este însoțit de o postare preluată de pe Twitter, care conține un videoclip (0:57 sec.) înregistrat în Cawsand, Cornwall, Marea Britanie.
În textul publicat pe Twitter, este menționat că utilizarea carburanților modificați de către companiile aeriene duce la o creștere semnificativă a cantității de nori gri în Anglia.
Utilizatorul introduce în text sugestia că, din punct de vedere meteorologic, vor urma perioade tulburi în toată lumea.
În videoclipul filmat în satul Cawsand, din Marea Britanie, se observă o atmosferă caracteristică pentru o vreme rece și cu vânt. În aceste condiții, cerul este acoperit de nori gri și temperaturile sunt mai reci, dat fiind faptul că vântul poate accentua senzația de frig.
Soarele este blocat în Regatul Unit?
Există într-adevăr o ramură științifică, denumită geoinginerie solară și care studiază în ce fel se poate interveni asupra radiației solare care ajunge pe Pământ, pentru a contracara încălzirea globală.
Tehnologiile de geoinginerie solară propuse au drept scop crearea unui strat subțire de particule, care să reflecte o parte a radiației solare – iar aceasta să se întoarcă înapoi în spațiul cosmic. Oamenii de știință sunt de părere că, astfel, cantitatea de radiație care ajunge la suprafața Pământului ar putea fi redusă în mod artificial, ceea ce ar duce, treptat, la scăderea temperaturilor globale.
Cu toate acestea, metodele de geoinginerie solară sunt în etape teoretice și, potrivit Universității Harvard, care are un departament de geoinginerie solară, ramura științifică nu poate înlocui metodele de reducere a emisiilor de carbon aprobate în prezent. Există multe incertitudini și riscuri asociate cu metodele propuse, inclusiv potențiale efecte negative asupra climei, interferențe cu ciclurile naturale ale Pământului și impact asupra ecosistemelor. Prin urmare, aceste metode sunt în continuare subiect de dezbateri în comunitatea științifică și nu există consens privind implementarea lor.
Totuși, se pot menționa două inițiative importante desfășurate ca parte din cercetarea în geoinginerie.
Un proiect început de Universitatea Harvard, care abordează încălzirea globală și impactul său asupra climei globale este Scopex. Prescurtat de la “Stratospheric Controlled Perturbation Experiment”, Scopex ar fi urmat să fie desfășurat în Suedia. Confruntată cu presiuni din partea localnicilor și activiștilor, Agenția spațială a Suediei a respins proiectul, în martie 2021.
“Stratospheric Aerosol Transport and Nucleation” (SATAN) este o altă inițiativă de cercetare care explorează transportul unei cantități mici de dioxid de sulf în stratosferă. În anii 2021 și 2022, au fost eliberate două baloane care transportau o oarecare cantitate de dioxid de sulf. Al doilea balon eliberat în anul 2022 a eliberat aproximativ 400 de grame de gaz în stratosferă, ca parte a inițiativei de cercetare legat de geoinginerie.
Guvernul Marii Britanii a adoptat o poziție deschisă, în mai 2020, referitor la abordarea problemei schimbărilor climatice și aportul geoingineriei. Administrația națională a menționat că monitorizează cercetările în domeniul gestionării radiației solare privind efectele asupra climei, dar NU desfășoară activități și nici nu există planuri în acest sens.
De ce este mai puțin soare în Marea Britanie?
Clima din Marea Britanie a fost într-adevăr atipică în acest an, ceea ce i-a și determinat pe jurnaliștii BBC să facă o amplă analiză, cu titlul „Unde a dispărut vara?”. Citând specialiștii din Met Office, serviciul de meteorologie al Marii Britanii, The Independent scrie că „principalul motiv pentru care Regatul Unit a evitat repetarea temperaturilor extreme din iulie 2022 – și căldura feroce care afectează în prezent Europa – este poziția curentului rapid de aer care suflă de la vest la est, deasupra Pământului. O mare parte a lunii iulie a anului trecut, curentul cu jet a fost blocat în nordul Marii Britanii, ținând la distanță sistemele de joasă presiune, provocând temperaturi foarte ridicate și lungi de condiții uscate”.
*Foto: BBC
Cel puțin în unele părți ale Regatului, vremea neobișnuit de rece a înregistrat și recorduri de precipitații.
Meteorologul Mike Kendon a explicat deja că, deși temperaturile pot să pară mici în comparație cu anii trecuți, s-ar fi încadrat peste media normală pentru perioada 1961-1990: „Deși iulie 2023 este considerată mai rece decât media, conform standardelor actuale, pentru o linie de referință climatică din 1961-1990, ar fi fost considerat un iulie mai cald decât media. Acesta este un exemplu tangibil al modului în care vedem schimbările climatice în datele noastre pe termen lung”.
Translation:
FALSE | In England, the sun would have been blocked, to combat global warming
FALSE | In England, the sun would have been blocked, to combat global warming
Published on Wednesday, August 16, 2023 at 09:32
The sun is blocked in Britain, claims a viral social media post, suggesting the cloud cover is actually the result of geoengineering.
And in Romania, a Facebook user posted a text with the same message:
"In the UK the sun is already blocked. The sky is covered in many parts non-stop by a gray blanket of clouds".
*Screen shot 08/06/2023
The message is accompanied by a post taken from Twitter, which contains a video (0:57 sec.) recorded in Cawsand, Cornwall, UK.
In the text published on Twitter, it is mentioned that the use of modified fuels by airlines leads to a significant increase in the amount of gray clouds in England.
The user introduces the suggestion in the text that, from a meteorological point of view, cloudy periods will follow all over the world.
In the video filmed in the village of Cawsand, in the UK, a characteristic atmosphere for cold and windy weather is observed. In these conditions, the sky is covered with gray clouds and the temperatures are colder, given that the wind can accentuate the feeling of cold.
Is the sun blocked in the UK?
There is indeed a branch of science called solar geoengineering that studies how solar radiation reaching the Earth can be manipulated to counteract global warming.
Proposed solar geoengineering technologies aim to create a thin layer of particles that reflects some of the sun's radiation – and sends it back into outer space. Scientists believe that in this way, the amount of radiation reaching the Earth's surface could be artificially reduced, which would gradually lead to a decrease in global temperatures.
However, solar geoengineering methods are in the theoretical stages, and according to Harvard University, which has a solar geoengineering department, the science cannot replace currently approved carbon reduction methods. There are many uncertainties and risks associated with the proposed methods, including potential negative effects on climate, interference with Earth's natural cycles, and impact on ecosystems. Therefore, these methods are still the subject of debate in the scientific community and there is no consensus on their implementation.
However, two important initiatives carried out as part of geoengineering research can be mentioned.
A project started by Harvard University that addresses global warming and its impact on the global climate is Scopex. Short for "Stratospheric Controlled Perturbation Experiment", Scopex was to be carried out in Sweden. Faced with pressure from locals and activists, the Swedish Space Agency rejected the project in March 2021.
"Stratospheric Aerosol Transport and Nucleation" (SATAN) is another research initiative that explores the transport of a small amount of sulfur dioxide in the stratosphere. In 2021 and 2022, two balloons carrying some amount of sulfur dioxide were released. The second balloon released in 2022 released about 400 grams of gas into the stratosphere as part of the geoengineering research initiative.
The UK government adopted an open position in May 2020 on addressing climate change and the contribution of geoengineering. The national administration has mentioned that it monitors research in the field of solar radiation management regarding the effects on the climate, but it does NOT carry out activities and there are no plans in this regard.
Why is there less sun in the UK?
The climate in Great Britain was indeed atypical this year, which prompted BBC journalists to do an extensive analysis, entitled "Where has the summer gone?". Quoting experts from the Met Office, Britain's weather service, The Independent writes that "the main reason the UK has avoided a repeat of the extreme temperatures of July 2022 - and the ferocious heat currently affecting Europe - is the position of the fast air current blowing from west to east above the Earth. For much of July last year, the jet stream was blocked across northern Britain, keeping low pressure systems at bay, causing very high temperatures and long periods of dry conditions."
*Photo: BBC
At least in some parts of the Kingdom, the unseasonably cold weather also saw record rainfall.
Meteorologist Mike Kendon has already explained that while temperatures may seem low compared to past years, they would have been above the normal average for the period 1961-1990: "Although July 2023 is considered colder than average by current standards, for a 1961-1990 climate baseline, would have been considered a warmer than average July. This is a tangible example of how we see climate change in our long-term data."

Factcheck: ‘Minstens één hoogbegaafde leerling per klas’ blijkt overschatting
Deze factcheck is uitgevoerd op basis van de beschikbare informatie op de datum van publicatie. Lees hier meer over hoe we werken.
‘In elke klas zit minstens één hoogbegaafd kind’, lezen we in verschillende nieuwsmedia. Dat blijkt een overschatting: volgens specialisten heeft ongeveer 2,5 procent van de bevolking een IQ van minstens 130, wat beschouwd wordt als de grens voor hoogbegaafdheid.
Op de website sociaal.net verscheen op 22 september een artikel met als titel ‘Hoogbegaafde kinderen en jongeren: er gaat veel talent verloren’.
‘In elke klas zit minstens één kind dat hoogbegaafd is’, wordt in de inleiding gesteld. Dat blijkt een uitspraak van professor Tessa Kieboom (Universiteit Hasselt), die bestuurder is bij het expertisecentrum over hoogbegaafdheid Exentra. In een filmpje van Universiteit Vlaanderen over hoogbegaafdheid haalt Kieboom hetzelfde cijfer aan, en ook in een interview met De Morgen (achter betaalmuur), verschenen op 12 november, zegt Kieboom dat er gemiddeld in elke klas één kind zit met hoogbegaafdheid.
Een lezer mailt daarop de de Knack-redactie met de vraag of het wel klopt dat er in elke klas minstens één hoogbegaafde zit. We nemen contact op met Tessa Kieboom met de vraag hoe ze tot die conclusie kwam.
‘Vanaf een IQ van 130 spreken we van hoogbegaafdheid’, legt Kieboom uit aan de telefoon. ‘We weten dat 2,3 procent van de bevolking bij een intelligentietest minstens 130 haalt, maar dat percentage is waarschijnlijk een onderschatting. Ik vermoed dat minstens 1 op de 25 à 30 leerlingen hoogbegaafd is, dus één per klas. Er gebeuren namelijk een aantal meetfouten bij de IQ-testen. Die beginnen meestal met makkelijke vragen waarna de moeilijkheidsgraad geleidelijk wordt opgevoerd. Dat maakt dat sommige hoogbegaafde kinderen geneigd zijn om de test ter discussie te stellen, en geen moeite meer doen om de “stomme” vragen te beantwoorden, of in ieder geval minder vertellen dan wat ze weten.’
Overschatting
We steken ook ons licht op bij Jeroen Lavrijsen. Lavrijsen is doctor in de pedagogische wetenschappen (KU Leuven) en werkt als postdoctoraal onderzoeker bij het Expertisecentrum Talent, dat tot doel heeft om aangepast onderwijs en begeleiding te voorzien voor kinderen en jongeren met sterke cognitieve vaardigheden.
‘Hoogbegaafdheid wordt doorgaans gedefinieerd als het beschikken over een IQ boven de 130. Dit komt overeen met de 2,5 procent cognitief sterkste personen in een leeftijdsgroep’, legt Lavrijsen uit.
‘Er circuleren nog andere definities van hoogbegaafdheid, en de IQ-grens op 130 is enigszins arbitrair want er is geen kwalitatief verschil tussen een IQ van 129 en een van 130. Toch blijft die definitie van hoogbegaafdheid de meest courante en naar mijn mening ook de meest heldere voor onderzoek en rapportering. Dit is wat je kunt meten met een IQ-test, en IQ-testen hebben net als alle testen een foutenmarge, maar zijn binnen de psychologie wel de meest betrouwbare testen.’
Extra uitdaging
Eén hoogbegaafde leerling per klas is dan ook een overschatting, zegt Lavrijsen. ‘Er zitten geen 40 kinderen in een klas, en al zeker niet in de basisschool waar de norm eerder 20 à 25 is. Het is wel een terechte vraag om leerkrachten te sensibiliseren om alert te zijn voor de noden van hoogbegaafde kinderen. Bovendien hebben niet enkel hoogbegaafde kinderen extra uitdaging nodig. Iedere leerling met sterke cognitieve vaardigheden, dat wil zeggen met een IQ van 120 of meer, loopt het risico op school te weinig uitgedaagd te worden.’
Marlies Tierens, doctor in de medische wetenschappen, klinisch psycholoog en lector-onderzoeker aan Thomas More, deelt de analyse van Lavrijsen dat één hoogbegaafde leerling per klas een overschatting is. Maar ook zij pleit ervoor om extra aandacht te besteden en uitdaging aan te bieden aan alle leerlingen die cognitief sterk zijn. ‘Dan hebben we het over ongeveer 10 procent van de leerlingen, wat dus betekent dat ongeveer twee cognitief begaafde kinderen per klas aangepast onderwijs nodig hebben.’
Conclusie
‘In elke klas zit minstens één hoogbegaafd kind’, lezen we in verschillende nieuwsmedia. Dat blijkt een overschatting: volgens specialisten heeft ongeveer 2,5 procent van de bevolking een IQ van minstens 130, wat beschouwd wordt als de grens voor hoogbegaafdheid. We beoordelen de claim dat er in elke klas minstens één hoogbegaafd kind zit daarom als eerder onwaar.
Bronnen
In het artikel vindt u links naar alle gebruikte bronnen.
Bovendien werden voor deze factcheck de volgende mensen gecontacteerd:
-Telefoongesprek en mailverkeer met Tessa Kieboom tussen 10 oktober en 23 november 2022
-Telefoongesprek en mailverkeer met Jeroen Lavrijsen tussen 22 en 25 november 2022
– Telefoongesprek en mailverkeer met Marlies Tierens tussen 24 en 28 november 2022
Alle bronnen werden laatst geraadpleegd op 28 november 2022.
Meer informatie over de factchecks vindt u op de website van Knack.
U vindt onze factchecks ook terug bij deCheckers, samen met betrouwbare factchecks van andere Vlaamse redacties.
Knack is erkend lid van het International Fact-Checking Network (IFCN) en European Fact-Checking Standards Network (EFCSN).
Krasse uitspraak, straf cijfer of dito feit in de actualiteit gezien?
Vul uw vraag in op de website van deCheckers met exacte bronvermelding van het citaat of stuur het naar factcheck@knack.be.
Knack maakt onderdeel uit van Roularta Media Group.
Translation:
Fact check: 'At least one gifted student per class' appears to be an overestimation
This fact check was carried out based on the information available at the date of publication. Read more about how we work here.
“There is at least one gifted child in every class,” we read in various news media. This turns out to be an overestimation: according to specialists, about 2.5 percent of the population has an IQ of at least 130, which is considered the limit for giftedness.
An article entitled 'Gifted children and young people: a lot of talent is being lost' was published on the social.net website on September 22.
“There is at least one gifted child in every class,” the introduction states. This is evident from a statement by Professor Tessa Kieboom (Hasselt University), who is a director at the Exentra expertise center on giftedness. In a video from the University of Flanders about giftedness, Kieboom cites the same figure, and in an interview with De Morgen (behind a paywall), published on November 12, Kieboom says that on average there is one gifted child in every class.
A reader then emails the Knack editors asking whether it is true that there is at least one gifted person in every class. We contact Tessa Kieboom to ask how she came to that conclusion.
“From an IQ of 130 we speak of giftedness,” Kieboom explains on the phone. 'We know that 2.3 percent of the population scores at least 130 on an intelligence test, but that percentage is probably an underestimate. I suspect that at least 1 in 25 to 30 students is gifted, so one per class. There are a number of measurement errors in IQ tests. They usually start with easy questions after which the difficulty level is gradually increased. This means that some gifted children are inclined to question the test and no longer make an effort to answer the "stupid" questions, or at least tell less than what they know.'
Overestimation
We also learn from Jeroen Lavrijsen. Lavrijsen has a doctorate in educational sciences (KU Leuven) and works as a postdoctoral researcher at the Talent Expertise Center, which aims to provide adapted education and guidance for children and young people with strong cognitive skills.
“Giftedness is usually defined as having an IQ above 130. This corresponds to the 2.5 percent cognitively strongest people in an age group,” Lavrijsen explains.
'There are other definitions of giftedness circulating, and the IQ limit of 130 is somewhat arbitrary because there is no qualitative difference between an IQ of 129 and one of 130. Yet that definition of giftedness remains the most common and, in my opinion, also the clearest for research and reporting. This is what you can measure with an IQ test, and IQ tests, like all tests, have a margin of error, but are the most reliable tests in psychology.'
Extra challenge
One gifted student per class is therefore an overestimation, says Lavrijsen. 'There are not 40 children in a class, and certainly not in primary school where the norm is 20 to 25. It is a legitimate question to sensitize teachers to be alert to the needs of gifted children. Moreover, not only gifted children need extra challenge. Every student with strong cognitive skills, i.e. with an IQ of 120 or more, runs the risk of not being challenged enough at school.'
Marlies Tierens, doctor in medical sciences, clinical psychologist and lecturer-researcher at Thomas More, shares Lavrijsen's analysis that one gifted student per class is an overestimation. But she also advocates paying extra attention and offering a challenge to all students who are cognitively strong. 'We are talking about approximately 10 percent of the students, which means that approximately two cognitively gifted children per class need adapted education.'
Conclusion
“There is at least one gifted child in every class,” we read in various news media. This turns out to be an overestimation: according to specialists, about 2.5 percent of the population has an IQ of at least 130, which is considered the limit for giftedness. We therefore assess the claim that there is at least one gifted child in every class as rather untrue.
Sources
In the article you will find links to all sources used.
In addition, the following people were contacted for this fact check:
-Telephone conversation and email with Tessa Kieboom between October 10 and November 23, 2022
-Telephone conversation and email with Jeroen Lavrijsen between November 22 and 25, 2022
– Telephone conversation and email traffic with Marlies Tierens between November 24 and 28, 2022
All sources were last consulted on November 28, 2022.
More information about the fact checks can be found on the Knack website.
You will also find our fact checks at deCheckers, together with reliable fact checks from other Flemish editors.
Knack is a recognized member of the International Fact-Checking Network (IFCN) and European Fact-Checking Standards Network (EFCSN).
Have you seen a bold statement, penalty or ditto fact in current events?
Complete your question on the deCheckers website with the exact source of the quote or send it to factcheck@knack.be.
Knack is part of Roularta Media Group.

Régulation des jets privés : que peut faire l’Union européenne ?
Régulation des jets privés : que peut faire l’Union européenne ?
Publié le mercredi 14 septembre 2022 à 11:26
(Creative Commons c)
- Auteur(s)
Auteur : Naël Leites, master de droit de l’Union européenne, Université de Lille
Relecteur : Vincent Couronne, docteur en droit européen, chercheur associé au centre de recherches VIP, Université Paris-Saclay
L’Union européenne pourrait réguler les jets privés en réponse aux enjeux climatiques actuels.
Après un été marqué par les effets très visibles du changement climatique en France, la dénonciation sur les réseaux sociaux des voyages en jets privés a pris une ampleur inédite. Récemment, c’est le directeur à la SNCF des TGV et Intercités, Alain Krakovitch, qui est monté au créneau sur Twitter contre le PSG qui a fait son déplacement à Nantes en jet privé, pour aller disputer un match de la Ligue 1 alors qu’il suffit de deux heures en train pour rejoindre la cité des Ducs de Bretagne depuis Paris.
Selon un rapport de l’ONG Transport & Environment publié en mai, les vols privés ont une empreinte carbone par passager de 5 à 14 fois supérieure aux vols commerciaux et 50 fois supérieure au train. Ils représenteraient 0,2 % des émissions de gaz à effet de serre à l’échelle mondiale. À ce titre, Julien Bayou, secrétaire national d’Europe Ecologie-Les Verts (EELV) a estimé, dimanche 21 août, que le temps était venu de “bannir” les jets privés. Le coprésident du groupe EELV à l’Assemblée nationale espère déposer “à l’automne“, avec les députés de la Nouvelle union populaire écologique et sociale (NUPES), une proposition de loi en ce sens.
Plus mesuré, le ministre délégué chargé des transports, Clément Beaune, a proposé de “réguler” les vols en avion privé, ajoutant qu’il serait plus efficace d’agir sur cette question au niveau européen “pour avoir les mêmes règles et le plus d’impact”.
Verdir la politique européenne des transports aériens
Le Traité sur le fonctionnement de l’Union européenne (TFUE) range les transports dans la catégorie des compétences partagées entre l’Union et les États membres. Ainsi les États peuvent réglementer le transport aérien tant que l’Union n’a pas exercé sa compétence, c’est-à-dire, comme le disent les juristes, tant que l’Union n’a pas “préempté ce domaine”. Ainsi, dans une large mesure, la politique des transports se décide au niveau européen.
Prévue par le titre VI du TFUE, la politique commune des transports a mis en œuvre la libéralisation de l’ensemble des moyens de transport, dont le transport aérien. Cette libéralisation doit permettre, selon le traité, d’accroître la compétitivité des entreprises, d’améliorer la qualité du service fourni aux usagers et de réduire les prix.
Par ailleurs, la Commission européenne a initié en 2001 le projet de “Ciel unique européen”, afin d’harmoniser la gestion du trafic aérien à l’échelle du continent, initiative qui aurait pour conséquence de réduire de 10 % les émissions du secteur, mais qui n’a toujours pas abouti.
Par un règlement adopté en 2005 par le Parlement européen et le Conseil (le Conseil réunit les ministres des États membres), une liste noire des compagnies aériennes de l’Union européenne a été instituée. C’est ainsi que la Commission européenne peut interdire à certaines compagnies aériennes, de manière totale ou partielle, d’accéder à l’espace aérien européen, notamment pour des raisons de sécurité. L’Union européenne a également fermé son espace aérien aux compagnies russes en réaction à l’invasion de l’Ukraine.
La politique européenne du transport vise enfin à harmoniser les règles de sécurité, par exemple dans les domaines aérien, routier et maritime, la fiscalité (encadrement des taxes sur les carburants…), ou encore les conditions de travail (durée du travail à bord des navires ou des camions…) en Europe.
À partir des années 2010, la politique européenne des transports a connu un “verdissement”. Après la stratégie “Transports 2050” suivie au cours des années 2010, la Commission européenne a présenté en décembre 2020 un nouveau plan censé rendre la mobilité plus durable. En matière aérienne, il est prévu, d’ici à 2035, que des aéronefs zéro émission de grande capacité fonctionnant à l’hydrogène remplaceront les très polluants avions fonctionnant au kérosène.
De façon plus radicale, l’Union européenne pourrait s’inspirer de la loi française qui interdit un vol en avion commercial si une alternative en train est possible en moins de deux heures et demie, en l’appliquant également aux jets privés. Le PSG aurait ainsi été contraint de prendre le TGV plutôt que l’avion pour se rendre à Nantes pour un match de la Ligue 1.
Le projet d’intégrer les transports aériens dans le marché carbone
Réguler les jets privés relève bien de la politique des transports, mais pas seulement. Une éventuelle initiative de l’Union se trouverait aussi au cœur de la gouvernance environnementale européenne : le marché carbone. Système d’échanges de quotas d’émission de CO2 créé en vertu du principe pollueur-payeur, il a pour objectif de mesurer, contrôler et réduire les émissions de ses industries et de ses producteurs d’électricité. Le marché du carbone est l’un des plus importants leviers dont dispose l’Union européenne pour abaisser les émissions de gaz à effet de serre de son industrie, en pénalisant les industries les plus polluantes. Ce marché peut donc constituer un outil efficace dans le cadre du Pacte vert pour l’Europe, en vertu duquel l’Union s’est fixé l’objectif contraignant de parvenir à la neutralité climatique d’ici à 2050. En juillet 2021, la Commission européenne avait présenté pas moins de treize textes juridiquement contraignants (cinq directives et huit règlements), qui doivent encore être adoptés par le Parlement européen et le Conseil. Il s’agit, comme jalon intermédiaire avant la neutralité complète, de baisser de 55 % les émissions de gaz à effet de serre par rapport aux niveaux de 1990 d’ici à 2030.
À ce titre, le transport aérien joue un rôle de premier plan. C’est la raison pour laquelle la Commission a proposé de supprimer les “permis de polluer” accordés à titre quasi gratuit aux compagnies aériennes, une exception de moins en moins justifiable alors qu’on demande aux autres secteurs de faire des efforts.
Une exception est en effet prévue dans la législation européenne pour l’aviation d’affaires et les vols d’agrément, qui comprend bien les jets utilisés “à des fins personnelles ou récréatives sans rapport avec une utilisation commerciale ou professionnelle”. Ces derniers demeurent donc, pour l’instant, exclus du système d’échange européen de quotas d’émissions carbone. Mais le texte étant seulement à l’état de proposition, rien n’empêche le Conseil de l’Union et le Parlement (les co-législateurs) de s’accorder pour le modifier en supprimant cette exception. D’ailleurs, Clément Beaune, qui siège au Conseil en tant que ministre délégué chargé des Transports, se dit prêt à intégrer les vols en jets privés “dans le système de la taxe carbone, en train d’être mise en place dans le paquet climat européen”. Le porte-parole du gouvernement, Olivier Véran, a également déclaré que Clément Beaune avait déjà proposé aux ministres de l’Union européenne d’examiner “les moyens de compenser les émissions de CO2” des vols en jet privé.
Taxer le kérosène à l’échelle européenne ?
Ensuite, la régulation des jets peut relever du domaine fiscal lorsqu’il s’agit d’encadrer les taxes sur les carburants. Le kérosène, utilisé pour les avions, est l’un des rares carburants exemptés de taxes, n’étant pas soumis à la directive européenne instaurée il y a plus de 15 ans sur la taxation de l’énergie. Les ONG demandent donc la mise en place d’une taxation de cette énergie fossile polluante. Une telle mesure pourrait être incluse dans le cadre du “paquet climat” de l’Union européenne. Seulement, la taxation du kérosène des jets privés relève de la politique fiscale de l’Union, et suppose une procédure législative spéciale très contraignante puisqu’elle requiert l’unanimité des 27 États membres. C’est cette unanimité qui bloque notamment l’adoption d’un impôt européen sur les sociétés.
Une autre mesure pourrait consister à accroître la transparence des vols d’affaires, par le biais de la Responsabilité sociale des entreprises (RSE), domaine largement européen ces dernières années. Selon Béatrice Jarrige, cheffe de projet au sein du Shift Project, il s’agirait de “suivre les politiques des entreprises qui utilisent des jets privés, et ainsi demander des seuils de réduction”.
Interdire les jets privés ?
Olivier Véran, porte-parole du gouvernement, à exprimé les réticences du gouvernement s’agissant de l’interdiction des jets privés, en mettant en avant des raisons économiques : “ce sont des transports commerciaux, on envoie des équipes sur place, avec une réactivité qui est importante, c’est créateur d’emplois”. Mais quels pourraient être les obstacles juridiques ?
Si la France était la seule à interdire les jets privés dans son espace aérien, elle mettrait en cause la liberté de circulation, principe cardinal de l’Union européenne garanti par le TFUE. Mais ce même traité prévoit des exemptions pour assurer la protection de l’environnement. Si une action en justice était menée contre une telle réglementation, la Cour de justice de l’Union européenne devrait apprécier si la justification environnementale invoquée par la France est nécessaire pour protéger l’environnement et qu’elle est proportionnée. Le ministre des Transports semble s’intéresser particulièrement aux voyages d’agrément. Mais rien ne dit qu’il serait impossible d’interdire aussi les vols d’affaires.
Si une interdiction des jets privés était décidée au niveau européen, un propriétaire de jet pourrait saisir le Tribunal de l’Union en invoquant la Charte des droits fondamentaux en vertu de laquelle : “Toute personne a le droit de jouir de la propriété des biens qu’elle a acquis légalement, de les utiliser, d’en disposer”… Mais les autres dispositions de la Charte des droits fondamentaux permettant de protéger l’environnement pourraient permettre à une politique volontariste de l’emporter face à l’argument de la liberté de circulation et du droit de propriété.
Auteurs :
Auteur : Naël Leites, master de droit de l’Union européenne, Université de Lille
Relecteur : Vincent Couronne, docteur en droit européen, chercheur associé au centre de recherches VIP, Université Paris-Saclay
Secrétariat de rédaction : Emma Cacciamani et Loïc Héreng
Translation:
Regulation of private jets: what can the European Union do?
Regulation of private jets: what can the European Union do?
Published on Wednesday September 14, 2022 at 11:26
(Creative Commons c)
- Author(s)
Author: Naël Leites, Master of European Union Law, University of Lille
Reviewer: Vincent Couronne, doctor in European law, associate researcher at the VIP research center, Université Paris-Saclay
The European Union could regulate private jets in response to current climate issues.
After a summer marked by the very visible effects of climate change in France, the denunciation on social networks of travel by private jets has taken on an unprecedented scale. Recently, it was the SNCF director of TGV and Intercités, Alain Krakovitch, who took to Twitter against PSG who traveled to Nantes by private jet, to play a Ligue 1 match while It only takes two hours by train to reach the city of the Dukes of Brittany from Paris.
According to a report by the NGO Transport & Environment published in May, private flights have a carbon footprint per passenger 5 to 14 times higher than commercial flights and 50 times higher than trains. They represent 0.2% of greenhouse gas emissions on a global scale. As such, Julien Bayou, national secretary of Europe Ecologie-Les Verts (EELV) estimated, Sunday August 21, that the time had come to “ban” private jets. The co-president of the EELV group in the National Assembly hopes to table a bill to this effect “in the fall”, with the deputies of the New Ecological and Social Popular Union (NUPES).
More measured, the Minister Delegate in charge of Transport, Clément Beaune, proposed to “regulate” private plane flights, adding that it would be more effective to act on this issue at the European level “to have the same rules and as much as possible. of impact”.
Greening European air transport policy
The Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU) places transport in the category of competences shared between the Union and the Member States. Thus States can regulate air transport as long as the Union has not exercised its competence, that is to say, as lawyers say, as long as the Union has not “pre-empted this area”. Thus, to a large extent, transport policy is decided at the European level.
Provided for by Title VI of the TFEU, the common transport policy implemented the liberalization of all means of transport, including air transport. This liberalization should make it possible, according to the treaty, to increase the competitiveness of businesses, improve the quality of service provided to users and reduce prices.
Furthermore, the European Commission initiated the “Single European Sky” project in 2001, in order to harmonize air traffic management across the continent, an initiative which would have the effect of reducing emissions from the sector by 10%, but which has still not been successful.
By a regulation adopted in 2005 by the European Parliament and the Council (the Council brings together the ministers of the Member States), a blacklist of airlines in the European Union was established. This is how the European Commission can prohibit certain airlines, totally or partially, from accessing European airspace, in particular for security reasons. The European Union also closed its airspace to Russian companies in response to the invasion of Ukraine.
Finally, European transport policy aims to harmonize safety rules, for example in the air, road and maritime sectors, taxation (regulation of fuel taxes, etc.), or even working conditions (working hours on board ships or trucks…) in Europe.
From the 2010s, European transport policy has experienced a “greening”. After the “Transport 2050” strategy followed during the 2010s, the European Commission presented in December 2020 a new plan intended to make mobility more sustainable. In terms of aviation, it is expected, by 2035, that large-capacity zero-emission aircraft running on hydrogen will replace the very polluting planes running on kerosene.
More radically, the European Union could take inspiration from the French law which prohibits a flight by commercial plane if an alternative by train is possible in less than two and a half hours, by also applying it to private jets. PSG would thus have been forced to take the TGV rather than the plane to go to Nantes for a Ligue 1 match.
The project to integrate air transport into the carbon market
Regulating private jets is indeed a transport policy, but not only that. A possible Union initiative would also be at the heart of European environmental governance: the carbon market. CO2 emission quota trading system created under the polluter pays principle, its objective is to measure, control and reduce the emissions of its industries and electricity producers. The carbon market is one of the most important levers available to the European Union to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from its industry, by penalizing the most polluting industries. This market can therefore constitute an effective tool within the framework of the European Green Deal, under which the Union has set itself the binding objective of achieving climate neutrality by 2050. In July 2021, the European Commission had presented no less than thirteen legally binding texts (five directives and eight regulations), which have yet to be adopted by the European Parliament and the Council. As an intermediate milestone before complete neutrality, it involves reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 55% compared to 1990 levels by 2030.
As such, air transport plays a leading role. This is why the Commission proposed removing the “permits to pollute” granted almost free of charge to airlines, an exception that is less and less justifiable while other sectors are being asked to make efforts.
An exception is in fact provided for in European legislation for business aviation and leisure flights, which includes jets used “for personal or recreational purposes unrelated to commercial or professional use”. The latter therefore remain, for the moment, excluded from the European carbon emissions trading system. But the text being only at the state of a proposal, nothing prevents the Council of the Union and the Parliament (the co-legislators) from agreeing to modify it by removing this exception. Moreover, Clément Beaune, who sits on the Council as deputy minister responsible for Transport, says he is ready to integrate private jet flights “into the carbon tax system, currently being implemented in the package European climate”. Government spokesperson Olivier Véran also said that Clément Beaune had already proposed to European Union ministers to examine “means of offsetting CO2 emissions” from private jet flights.
Tax kerosene on a European scale?
Then, the regulation of jets can come under the fiscal domain when it comes to regulating fuel taxes. Kerosene, used for airplanes, is one of the rare tax-exempt fuels, not being subject to the European directive introduced more than 15 years ago on energy taxation. NGOs are therefore calling for the establishment of taxation on this polluting fossil energy. Such a measure could be included as part of the European Union’s “climate package”. However, the taxation of kerosene from private jets falls under the Union's tax policy, and requires a very restrictive special legislative procedure since it requires the unanimity of the 27 Member States. It is this unanimity which notably blocks the adoption of a European corporate tax.
Another measure could consist of increasing the transparency of corporate thefts, through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), a largely European area in recent years. According to Béatrice Jarrige, project manager at the Shift Project, this would involve “following the policies of companies that use private jets, and thus asking for reduction thresholds”.
Ban private jets?
Olivier Véran, government spokesperson, expressed the government's reluctance regarding the ban on private jets, highlighting economic reasons: “these are commercial transports, we send teams to the site, with a responsiveness which is important, it creates jobs”. But what could be the legal obstacles?
If France were the only one to ban private jets in its airspace, it would call into question freedom of movement, a cardinal principle of the European Union guaranteed by the TFEU. But this same treaty provides for exemptions to ensure environmental protection. If legal action were taken against such regulation, the Court of Justice of the European Union would have to assess whether the environmental justification invoked by France is necessary to protect the environment and whether it is proportionate. The Minister of Transport seems to be particularly interested in leisure travel. But nothing says that it would be impossible to also ban business flights.
If a ban on private jets were decided at European level, a jet owner could refer the matter to the General Court of the Union invoking the Charter of Fundamental Rights under which: “Everyone has the right to enjoy ownership of property that they own. “it has legally acquired, to use them, to dispose of them”… But the other provisions of the Charter of Fundamental Rights allowing the protection of the environment could allow a proactive policy to prevail in the face of the argument of freedom of circulation and property rights.

Die Explosion eines Autos in der italienischen Stadt Mailand im Mai 2023 sorgt in heimischen Online-Gefilden (1,2) noch immer für Aufregung. So behaupten User, dass es sich um ein E-Auto gehandelt haben soll. Das Video des in Flammen stehenden Autos wird dabei vor allem unter Kritikern von Elektromobilität geteilt. Wichtige Informationen werden dabei aber weggelassen.
Einschätzung: Die Aufnahme zeigt eine Explosion von Sauerstoffflaschen in einem Lieferwagen. Zahlreiche Medien berichteten darüber. Nach Angaben der Feuerwehr in Mailand hat es sich um kein E-Auto gehandelt, sondern um eines mit Verbrennungsmotor.
Überprüfung: Zu dem Brand kam es am 11. Mai 2023 in der Innenstadt von Mailand in der Via Pier Lombardo (3). Über den Vorfall gibt es einen Tweet der italienischen Feuerwehr (4) sowie mehrere Medienberichte (5,6,7,8,9). Entgegen der Behauptung auf Social Media wurde auch im deutschen Fernsehen darüber berichtet (10). Alle Medien schrieben übereinstimmend, dass es zu mehreren Explosionen eines Lieferwagens kam, der mit Sauerstoffflaschen beladen war.
In der italienischen Tageszeitung „Il Fatto Quotidiano“ (11) steht etwa: „Zuerst fing der Motor des Lieferwagens Feuer, dann waren mehr als zehn Explosionen zu hören, von denen zwei sehr heftig waren. Die Explosion, die sich heute in Mailand ereignete und auch mehrere Stockwerke eines Gebäudes an der Ecke Via Pier Lombardo und Via Vasari betraf, ist auf einen Defekt des Lieferwagens zurückzuführen, der ein Dutzend Sauerstoffflaschen und -behälter transportierte.“
Das brennende Fahrzeug gehörte laut den Berichten (5) zu einem Transportunternehmen aus der Region Novara. Der Fahrer sagte in einem Interview, das der Brand beim Motor ausgebrochen sei und er vergeblich versucht habe, die Flammen mit den Händen zu bekämpfen.
Auch die Nachrichtenagenturen APA (12) und AFP (13) schrieben über den Vorfall. Nirgendwo findet sich ein Hinweis darauf, dass es sich um ein E-Auto gehandelt haben könnte.
Im Video selbst ist das Automodell nicht zu erkennen. Mehrere APA-Anfragen an die Polizei in Mailand, die Feuerwehr in Mailand sowie das Transportunternehmen in Novara blieben bis zur Veröffentlichung des Faktenchecks unbeantwortet. Gegenüber der Nachrichtenagentur AFP (14) bestätigte allerdings die Mailänder Feuerwehr, dass es sich bei dem in Flammen stehen Lieferwagen nicht um ein Elektrofahrzeug gehandelt habe.
Auch die polnischen Faktenchecker von „Fakenews.pl“ (15) konnten über einen italienischen Journalisten ein Statement der Feuerwehr in Mailand einholen, welche ebenfalls mitteilte, dass es sich um ein Auto mit Verbrennungsmotor gehandelt habe.
